alert.note: Alert for Brown (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 21 at 4:17PM EDT until May 21 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of South Central Ohio and Southwest Ohio, including the following counties, in South Central Ohio, Highland. In Southwest Ohio, Brown. * WHEN...Until 730 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 417 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Hillsboro, Marshall, Sardinia, Belfast, Rocky Fork Point, Highland Holiday, New Market, Mowrystown, Berrysville, State Route 136 at US Route 62, Highland County Airport, Fincastle, Rocky Fork Lake, State Route 32 at US Route 62, Rainsboro and Lake Waynoka.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Keep children away from storm drains, culverts, creeks and streams. Water levels can rise rapidly and sweep children away. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
